reviewText: Not the 'Blue Planet', but close enough. Everything is a notch down in comparison, but still an enjoyable watch with a lot of material that haven't been reused to death.
We learned so much from this informative documentary. Incredible underwater footage. Would highly recommend this one as well as Star Gardens.

I love any video that has to do with underwater and coral reefs. The Ocean Realm series is always high-quality and a joy to watch. I have watched videos that were supposed to be about the coral reefs and much of the video was about the crew and long minutes of them on the boat (time and time again) and their equiptment and on and on...this has none of that. It's about the underwater realm. Beautiful.

This is a great standard video if you are curious to learn what kelp in and about how underwater kelp interacts with surrounding sea life.  Lots of different sea creatures are shown.  Great educational tool.  Reminds me of the movies that were shown to me by my elementary school teacher way back when, and got me more knowledgeable/curious about the ocean and interested in a career that is environmentally/nature-related.
Well explained .Unfortunately it's not in HD
Very educational. I liked it a lot.
These Readers Digest Ocean Realm docs are the best underwater docs I have seen!
My grandson who is 5 loves anything ocean and sea related . He enjoys this day after day and watches it often !!!

very relaxing. i work night shift, so when i get home and about to go to bed, i start the movie and fall asleep right away. it's also a good watch when you're not tired. It's a relaxing and educational film i'd recommend to anyone interested in the ocean.

These are great. I put this on for my almost 2 yr old son and he sat and watched for a long while. Love to put something on tv that I can learn from and isn't complete garbage. Really liked this, looking at the other series now as well.

Admittedly, the footage is from several decades ago, and grainy and faded compared to today's standards. But if you look past that, there is some really amazing stuff in there, and the narration really brings the kelp forests to life in a way few nature documentaries manage.
Watched this with my 8 and 10 year old.  We were glued to the screen.  Would recommend to anyone.
